title: Caramelised pear tarts
description: A pot of tea, a warm pear tart, a roaring fire, an old movie - make it your Sunday ritual
instructions: Put the zest, water, and sugar in a pan; bring slowly to simmering point, dissolving the sugar. Add the pears.
Poach for 8 minutes until tender but firm. Remove the pears; allow to cool slightly, then slice each pear into a fan.
Put the butter in a hot pan. Once foaming, add the pears and brown sugar. Cook until caramelised.
Roll out the pastry and cut into 4-inch diameter circles. Place a pear fan on each. Bake for 15 minutes until puffed.
Heat the remaining caster sugar in a pan with the rest of the water until golden. Pour over the tarts. Allow to cool slightly and serve.
imageDesc: A wooden tray with three pear tarts on top, drizzled with liquid caramel
